UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that may represent a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Therapeutic Potential of a Scorpion Venom-Derived Antimicrobial Peptide and Its Homologs Against Antibiotic-Resistant Gram-Positive Bacteria.
Literature.Author: Liu G, Yang F, Li F, Li Z, Lang Y, Shen B, Wu Y, Li W, Harrison PL, Strong PN, Xie Y, Miller K, Cao Z

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Staphylococcus aureus AB94004(MIC=1.5µM),Staphylococcus aureus AB94004(MIC=3.0µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus AB94004(MIC=12µM),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 6538(MIC=1.5µM),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=3.0µM),Staphylococcus aureus AB208193(MIC=3.0µM),Staphylococcus epidermidis AB208187(MIC=1.5µM),Staphylococcus epidermidis AB208188(MIC=1.5µM),Micrococcus luteus AB93113(MIC=>48.3µM),Bacillus thuringiensis AB92037(MIC=1.5µM),Bacillus subtilis AB91021(MIC=3.0µM),Escherichia coli AB94012(MIC=>48.3µM),Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=12.1µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 9027(MIC=12.1µM),Staphylococcus aureus P1389(MIC=1.5µM),Staphylococcus aureus P1374(MIC=3.0µM),Staphylococcus aureus P1381(MIC=3.0µM)
